wikipedia_page.main: Charles Jarvis (11 November 1792 – October 1855) was an English first-class cricketer who played for Nottingham Cricket Club in the early 19th century. He played only one match recognised as first-class in 1826.

response: George Jarvis (24 June 1800 – 27 March 1880) was an English cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1826 to 1841.  He was a brother of Charles Jarvis.
*Charles Jervas (1675–1739), sometimes known as Charles Jarvis, Irish portrait painter
*Charles Jarvis (VC) (1881–1948), Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross
|Played in a total of 37 first-class matches, generally for sides from Nottinghamshire. Brother of Charles Jarvis.

response: |Played in 37 first-class matches, 13 of which were for Nottingham. Brother of Charles Jarvis.
